chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall d : nat, nat -> mon d

Premises:
Inductive mon : nat -> Set := n_0 : mon 0 | c_n : forall d : nat, nat -> mon d -> mon (S d) Arguments mon _%nat_scope Arguments c_n (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Inductive mon : nat -> Set := n_0 : mon 0 | c_n : forall d : nat, nat -> mon d -> mon (S d) Arguments mon _%nat_scope Arguments c_n (_ _)%nat_scope
c_n : forall d : nat, nat -> mon d -> mon (S d)
recomp : forall d : nat, d <> 0 -> mon d -> mon d
pmon1 : forall d : nat, mon d -> nat
mon_ind : forall P : forall n : nat, mon n -> Prop, P 0 n_0 -> (forall (d n : nat) (m : mon d), P d m -> P (S d) (c_n d n m)) -> forall (n : nat) (m : mon n), P n m
mon_rect : forall P : forall n : nat, mon n -> Type, P 0 n_0 -> (forall (d n : nat) (m : mon d), P d m -> P (S d) (c_n d n m)) -> forall (n : nat) (m : mon n), P n m
mon_sind : forall P : forall n : nat, mon n -> SProp, P 0 n_0 -> (forall (d n : nat) (m : mon d), P d m -> P (S d) (c_n d n m)) -> forall (n : nat) (m : mon n), P n m
mon_rec : forall P : forall n : nat, mon n -> Set, P 0 n_0 -> (forall (d n : nat) (m : mon d), P d m -> P (S d) (c_n d n m)) -> forall (n : nat) (m : mon n), P n m
pmon2 : forall d : nat, mon d -> mon (Init.Nat.pred d)
recomp_ok : forall (d : nat) (h : d <> 0) (m : mon d), recomp d h m = m
proj_ok : forall (d : nat) (m : mon (S d)), c_n d (pmon1 (S d) m) (pmon2 (S d) m) = m
nat_rect : forall P : nat -> Type, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
BinNatDef.N.shiftr_nat = fun a : BinNums.N => nat_rect (fun _ : nat => BinNums.N) a (fun _ : nat => BinNatDef.N.div2) : BinNums.N -> forall n : nat, (fun _ : nat => BinNums.N) n Arguments BinNatDef.N.shiftr_nat _%N_scope _%nat_scope
Inductive le (n : nat) : nat -> Prop := le_n : n <= n | le_S : forall m : nat, n <= m -> n <= S m Arguments le (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments le_n _%nat_scope Arguments le_S (_ _)%nat_scope
option_map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> option A -> option B
Pnat.Nat2Pos.id : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> BinPos.Pos.to_nat (BinPos.Pos.of_nat n) = n
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.pow = fix pow (n m : nat) {struct m} : nat := match m with | 0 => 1 | S m0 => n * pow n m0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pow (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.leb = fix leb (n m : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => true | S n' => match m with | 0 => false | S m' => leb n' m' end end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments Init.Nat.leb (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.pred = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => n | S u => u end : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.pred _%nat_scope
BinPosDef.Pos.to_nat = fun x : BinNums.positive => BinPosDef.Pos.iter_op Init.Nat.add x 1 : BinNums.positive -> nat Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.to_nat _%positive_scope : simpl never
BinPosDef.Pos.of_nat = fix of_nat (n : nat) : BinNums.positive := match n with | S (S _ as x) => BinPosDef.Pos.succ (of_nat x) | _ => BinNums.xH end : nat -> BinNums.positive Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.of_nat _%nat_scope
Nat.le_0_l : forall n : nat, 0 <= n
O_S : forall n : nat, 0 <> S n
Pnat.Nat2Pos.id_max : forall n : nat, BinPos.Pos.to_nat (BinPos.Pos.of_nat n) = Init.Nat.max 1 n
Nat.pow_eq_0_iff : forall a b : nat, a ^ b = 0 < -> b <> 0 /\ a = 0
Byte.to_of_nat_option_map : forall x : nat, option_map Byte.to_nat (Byte.of_nat x) = (if x <=? 255 then Some x else None)
Inductive N : Set := N0 : BinNums.N | Npos : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNums.Npos _%positive_scope
Inductive option (A : Type) : Type := Some : A -> option A | None : option A Arguments option _%type_scope Arguments Some {A}%type_scope a : rename Arguments None {A}%type_scope
